title: Fundamentals of the South African Assembly

questions.question: What is the primary mission of The South African Assembly (TSAA)?
options: To form a new political party to contest elections
To replace the current Republic’s constitution
To act as a private financial trust for members
To reconstruct lawful self-governance under Common Law

questions.question: According to TSAA, what is the main problem the Assembly seeks to correct?
options: Unregistered business entities
Misidentification of living people as corporate persons
Lack of foreign investment
Insufficient parliamentary representation

questions.question: What does “land-and-soil jurisdiction” represent in TSAA teachings?
options: An ecological conservation area
A division of the South African courts system
The lawful realm of living men and women under Common Law
The maritime domain used for international trade

questions.question: Which statement best describes the difference between lawful and legal systems?
options: Legal law is superior to lawful law
They are the same and used interchangeably
Lawful applies only to religious organizations
Lawful is based on natural moral law, while legal is corporate statutory law

questions.question: What does “status correction” achieve for a member of the Assembly?
options: It changes one’s tax registration number
It converts a business into a non-profit organization
It restores one’s standing as a living man or woman on the land and soil
It renounces citizenship and residency rights

questions.question: What is the role of the Land Recording Office (LRO) within TSAA?
options: To collect property tax on behalf of the state
To record lawful declarations and public notices for Assembly members
To manage electronic voting for the Assembly
To register corporate business licenses

questions.question: In TSAA teachings, what is the “strawman”?
options: A nickname for Assembly peacekeepers
A fictional corporate identity created through birth registration
A symbol of agricultural abundance
A legal representative appointed by the state

questions.question: According to Common Law as described by TSAA, when does a crime exist?
options: When a government official issues a fine
Only when there is a victim who suffers harm or loss
Whenever a contract is breached
Whenever someone violates a statutory rule

questions.question: Which of the following best expresses the Assembly’s philosophy of governance?
options: Delegation of power to foreign trustees
Rule by corporate administration for profit
Enforcement through military authority
Peaceable self-governance by the people under Common Law

questions.question: What core values does TSAA associate with true law under land and soil jurisdiction?
options: Fear and control
Profit and expansion
Obedience and punishment
Love and gratitude
